com.brashmonkey.spriter

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.brashmonkey.spriter.Player
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PlayerTweener

    public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    A Player instance is responsible for updating an Animation properly. With the update() method an instance of this class will increase its current time and update the current set animation (setAnimation(Animation)). A Player can be positioned with setPivot(float, float), scaled with setScale(float), flipped with flip(boolean, boolean) and rotated setAngle(float). A Player has various methods for runtime object manipulation such as #setBone(String, Bone) or . Events like the ending of an animation can be observed with the Player.PlayerListener interface. Character maps can be changed on the fly, just by assigning a character maps to characterMaps, setting it to null will remove the current character map.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Player.Attachment
      An attachment is an abstract object which can be attached to a Player object.
      static interface  Player.PlayerListener
      A listener to listen for specific events which can occur during the runtime of a Player instance.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates this player. This means the current time gets increased by speed and is applied to the current animation.

      • unmapObjects

        public void unmapObjects(Mainline.Key.BoneRef base)
        Maps all object from the parent's coordinate system to the global coordinate system.
        Parameters:
        base - the root bone to start at. Set it to null to traverse the whole bone hierarchy.

      • setEntity

        public void setEntity(Entity entity)
        Sets the entity for this player instance. The animation will be switched to the first one of the new entity.
        Parameters:
        entity - the new entity
        Throws:
        SpriterException - if the entity is null

        Throws:

      • getBoundingRectangle

        public Rectangle getBoundingRectangle(Mainline.Key.BoneRef root)
        Returns a bounding box for this player. The bounding box is calculated for all bones and object starting from the given root.
        Parameters:
        root - the starting root. Set it to null to calculate the bounding box for the whole player
        Returns:
        the bounding box

      • getBoudingRectangle

        public Rectangle getBoudingRectangle(Timeline.Key.Bone root)

        Parameters:
        root - the starting root. Set it to null to calculate the bounding box for the whole player
        Returns:
        the bounding box

      • getCurrentKey

        public Mainline.Key getCurrentKey()
        Returns the current main line key based on the current time.
        Returns:
        the current main line key

      • getTime

        public int getTime()
        Returns the current time. The player will make sure that the current time is always between 0 and Animation.length.
        Returns:
        the current time

      • setTime

        public Player setTime(int time)
        Sets the time for the current time. The player will make sure that the new time will not exceed the time bounds of the current animation.
        Parameters:
        time - the new time
        Returns:
        this player to enable chained operations

      • setScale

        public Player setScale(float scale)
        Sets the scale of this player to the given one. Only uniform scaling is supported.
        Parameters:
        scale - the new scale. 1f means 100% scale.
        Returns:
        this player to enable chained operations

      • scale

        public Player scale(float scale)
        Scales this player based on the current set scale.
        Parameters:
        scale - the scaling factor. 1f means no scale.
        Returns:
        this player to enable chained operations

      • getScale

        public float getScale()
        Returns the current scale.
        Returns:
        the current scale

                   boolean y)
        Flips this player around the x and y axis.

        y - whether to flip the player around the y axis

        this player to enable chained operations

      • flippedX

        public int flippedX()
        Returns whether this player is flipped around the x axis.
        Returns:
        1 if this player is not flipped, -1 if it is flipped

        Returns:
        1 if this player is not flipped, -1 if it is flipped

      • setPivot

        public Player setPivot(float x,
                       float y)
        Sets the pivot, i.e. origin, of this player. A pivot at (0,0) means that the origin of the played animation will have the same one as in Spriter.
        Parameters:
        x - the new pivot in x direction
        y - the new pivot in y direction
        Returns:
        this player to enable chained operations

      • setPivot

        public Player setPivot(Point pivot)
        Sets the pivot, i.e. origin, of this player. A pivot at (0,0) means that the origin of the played animation will have the same one as in Spriter.
        Parameters:
        pivot - the new pivot
        Returns:
        this player to enable chained operations

      • translatePivot

                             float y)

        y - the amount in y direction

        this player to enable chained operations
